intro: Tabernaemontana rupicola, commonly known as the rock tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has a woody stem and thrives in well-drained soils, often growing on rocky outcrops. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly glossy appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses, though it requires specific care to thrive.
